dc_description_s: The Maintenance Responsibility layer is a delineation of which entities are responsible for maintenance on Michigan Trunkline routes. This information enables MDOT to track and compare the costs of doing business between the various parties responsible for maintenance. These parties include MDOT maintenance garages, county road commissions, cities, and bridge authorities. Please see the MDOT Metadata Form for additional information. Update Cycle: Maintenance Responsibility is updated on an annual basis in conjunction with the Lane Mile Inventory (LMI) release and is based on the new framework version. Any additional changes to the data are provided by the data owner to DOGMA staff for inclusion that year.Coverage: This inventory is complete in its coverage of all State of Michigan trunkline roadways.Symbology: The symbology for the Maintenance Responsibility layer is categorized using the MAINTENANCE field and grouped by MDOT, County, and Local Agency services with different colors for each and a size 2 line.Contact: Margaret Kramer, kramerm@michigan.gov
